pros: Easy to move up, small community feel
Good coworkers, responsive leadership, opportunities for advancement

review_title: All Chiefs, less and less Indians every day
pros: If you live in Lompoc, it's a job you don't have to commute very far to get to.  The ONLY pro.
cons: Top-heavy management.  Employee morale at all-time low.  No raises for years.  HR only supportive of CEO and other  upper management.  Employees have no support from HR if they are being mistreated by supervisors/upper management.  No concern for patient care, especially with the greed-driven Electronic Medical Record mandate, where hospital will receive $7 million for using EMR and laying off loyal employees.

review_title: Place is run by the good old boys; beware!
job_title: HIM Department Secretary in Lompoc, CA
pros: Surgical Department and staff are great people. Nice-appearing building.
cons: Upper management generally corrupt. You can be tagged as a target to be fired and labeled as a “troublemaker or complainer” if you go to HR with valid issues.  The ER is terrible. Gossips run rampant and get preferential treatment. Brown nosers get rewarded, while hard workers suffer and get no rewards.

pros:
Great people and dedication to doing a great job for LVMC and the community. 
Great management , Competitive wages and as a employee for 11yrs LVMC has been a top tier employer!
Making a Difference:  " You get to make a difference in real people's lives every day and get paid for it"
cons: Exposure to germs and seeing sickness!

pros: Great management, room for growth, excellent pay & compensation. Things have definitely improved over the years with technology. Always improving.
cons: The radiologist have been challenging to deal with over the years. Sometimes the workload can be a little daunting. The nurses on the floor can be a bit lazy.

job_title: Director of Dietary Services in Lompoc, CA
pros: Salary was very generous.  Flexible days and hours, depending on needs.  Staff were more like family.
cons: Working the floor, created problems with completing job responsibilities.

review_title: Don't waste your time or talents
pros: Unfortunately the only pro is if you live inLompoc your commute is easy
cons: The Champion Center is poorly managed by a company called Addiction Medicine.  The charlatan administrators at this company have no experience or expertise in the delivery of quality care for our First Responders, i.e. Veterans, police, and firefighters.  Stay away from this bogus for profit scheme.

Poor pay, no paid holidays, expensive benefits. This is all on top of a toxic culture with rampant nepotism. Any young promising talent need not apply. However, if you have no current skills or qualifications but are a personal friend of management, every door will unlock for you.
